monq.jfa.actions

Class Replace

  • java.lang.Object
    • monq.jfa.AbstractFaAction
      • monq.jfa.actions.Replace
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FaAction

    public class Replace
extends AbstractFaAction
    implements an FaAction which replaces the matched input with a fixed string.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.5 $, $Date: 2005-02-20 21:13:50 $
    Author:
    © 2003, 2004 Harald Kirsch
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Replace(java.lang.String s)
      calls the 2 parameter constructor with priority==0.
      Replace(java.lang.String s, int prio)
      creates an FaAction with the given priority which replaces the matched text with the string given.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public void invoke(java.lang.StringBuilder out,
          int start,
          DfaRun runner)
        Description copied from interface: FaAction

        is called by methods of DfaRun in case of a match. Parameter yytext contains the matching text from position start onwards. The callback may change the whole of yytext, but the under most circumstances, only the matching text should be changed. Parameter runner is the DfaRun object which called this function. Of interest are its fields DfaRun.clientData and DfaRun.collect.
